pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 193, 304, 209]]<|/det|>
# FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 217, 154, 231]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF10)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 352, 828, 368]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 500, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 447, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 504, 509]]<|/det|>
The use of a calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 907, 540]]<|/det|>
Results obtained solely from a graphic calculator, without supporting working or reasoning, will not receive credit.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 606, 586]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 586, 756, 602]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 798, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the cartesian equation corresponding to the polar equation \(r = (\sqrt{2}) \sec (\theta - \frac{1}{4}\pi)\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[88, 106, 912, 141]]<|/det|>
Sketch the the graph of \(r = (\sqrt{2}) \sec (\theta - \frac{1}{4}\pi)\), for \(- \frac{1}{4}\pi < \theta < \frac{3}{4}\pi\), indicating clearly the polar coordinates of the intersection with the initial line.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 123, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 170, 97, 190]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 170, 544, 190]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation \(y = 2x^{\frac{1}{2}}\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 4\). Find  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 197, 154, 215]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 197, 562, 215]]<|/det|>
the mean value of \(y\) with respect to \(x\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 4\),  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 222, 156, 240]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 221, 873, 240]]<|/det|>
the \(y\)-coordinate of the centroid of the region enclosed by \(C\), the line \(x = 4\) and the \(x\)-axis.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 266, 97, 286]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 266, 537, 286]]<|/det|>
Find the general solution of the differential equation  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 293, 636, 327]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +4\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +13x = 26t^{2} + 3t + 13.\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 303, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 359, 97, 378]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 359, 411, 378]]<|/det|>
Let \(\operatorname {f}(r) = r(r + 1)(r + 2)\). Show that  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 384, 606, 404]]<|/det|>
\[\operatorname {f}(r) - \operatorname {f}(r - 1) = 3r(r + 1).\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 420, 490, 462]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(\sum_{r = 1}^{n}r(r + 1) = \frac{1}{3} n(n + 1)(n + 2).\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 472, 695, 514]]<|/det|>
Using the standard result for \(\sum_{r = 1}^{n}r\), deduce that \(\sum_{r = 1}^{n}r^{2} = \frac{1}{6} n(n + 1)(2n + 1).\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 522, 328, 541]]<|/det|>
Find the sum of the series  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[262, 546, 737, 567]]<|/det|>
\[1^{2} + 2\times 2^{2} + 3^{2} + 2\times 4^{2} + 5^{2} + 2\times 6^{2} + \ldots +2(n - 1)^{2} + n^{2},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 574, 245, 592]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is odd.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 574, 920, 592]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 621, 97, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 618, 599, 655]]<|/det|>
Let \(I_{n}\) denote \(\int_{0}^{\infty}x^{n}\mathrm{e}^{- 2x}\mathrm{d}x.\) Show that \(I_{n} = \frac{1}{2} nI_{n - 1},\) for \(n\geqslant 1.\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 667, 715, 696]]<|/det|>
Prove by mathematical induction that, for all positive integers \(n\), \(I_{n} = \frac{n!}{2^{n + 1}}.\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 724, 97, 742]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 724, 426, 742]]<|/det|>
Use de Moivre's theorem to show that  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 749, 625, 768]]<|/det|>
\[\cos 4\theta = 8\cos^{4}\theta -8\cos^{2}\theta +1.\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 750, 920, 768]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 785, 923, 806]]<|/det|>
Without using a calculator, verify that \(\cos 4\theta = - \cos 3\theta\) for each of the values \(\theta = \frac{1}{7}\pi , \frac{3}{7}\pi , \frac{5}{7}\pi , \pi .\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 818, 740, 838]]<|/det|>
Using the result \(\cos 3\theta = 4\cos^{3}\theta - 3\cos \theta\), show that the roots of the equation  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 844, 611, 864]]<|/det|>
\[8c^{4} + 4c^{3} - 8c^{2} - 3c + 1 = 0\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 871, 358, 891]]<|/det|>
are \(\cos \frac{1}{7}\pi\), \(\cos \frac{3}{7}\pi\), \(\cos \frac{5}{7}\pi\), \(- 1\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 904, 450, 924]]<|/det|>
Deduce that \(\cos \frac{1}{7}\pi + \cos \frac{3}{7}\pi + \cos \frac{5}{7}\pi = \frac{1}{2}.\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 905, 920, 924]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 326, 92]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 94, 561, 122]]<|/det|>
\[y = \lambda x + \frac{x}{x - 2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 125, 715, 144]]<|/det|>
where \(\lambda\) is a non-zero constant. Find the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 156, 918, 175]]<|/det|>
Show that \(C\) has no turning points if \(\lambda < 0\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 186, 803, 206]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\) in the case \(\lambda = -1\), stating the coordinates of the intersections with the axes. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 234, 96, 253]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 234, 423, 253]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 260, 594, 284]]<|/det|>
\[x = \textstyle \frac{1}{3} t^{3} - \ln t,\quad y = \textstyle \frac{4}{3} t^{\frac{3}{2}},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 291, 428, 310]]<|/det|>
for \(1\leqslant t\leqslant 3\). Find the arc length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 291, 918, 310]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 322, 895, 342]]<|/det|>
Find also the area of the surface generated when \(C\) is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 337, 918, 355]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 384, 96, 402]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 326, 402]]<|/det|>
The plane \(\varPi\) has equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[307, 408, 688, 428]]<|/det|>
\[{\bf r} = 2{\bf i} + 3{\bf j} - {\bf k} + \lambda ({\bf i} - 2{\bf j} + 2{\bf k}) + \mu (3{\bf i} + {\bf j} - 2{\bf k}).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 435, 500, 454]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\), which does not lie in \(\varPi\), has equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 460, 636, 480]]<|/det|>
\[{\bf r} = 3{\bf i} + 6{\bf j} + 12{\bf k} + t(8{\bf i} + 5{\bf j} - 8{\bf k}).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 488, 341, 507]]<|/det|>
Show that \(l\) is parallel to \(\varPi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 489, 918, 507]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 518, 920, 554]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of the point at which the line with equation \(\mathbf{r} = 5\mathbf{i} - 4\mathbf{j} + 7\mathbf{k} + s(2\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k})\) meets \(\varPi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 552, 920, 571]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 565, 798, 585]]<|/det|>
Find the perpendicular distance from the point with position vector \(9\mathbf{i} + 11\mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k}\) to \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 567, 920, 586]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 612, 104, 631]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 612, 529, 631]]<|/det|>
Write down the eigenvalues of the matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 636, 591, 689]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{ccc}1 & 4 & -16\\ 0 & 2 & 3\\ 0 & 0 & 3 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 653, 920, 672]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 706, 386, 725]]<|/det|>
Find corresponding eigenvectors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 706, 920, 725]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 737, 794, 756]]<|/det|>
Let \(n\) be a positive integer. Write down a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 763, 551, 782]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A}^{n} = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 764, 918, 782]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 802, 256, 821]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathbf{P}^{-1}\) and \(\mathbf{A}^{n}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 802, 920, 821]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 833, 314, 852]]<|/det|>
Hence find \(\lim_{n \to \infty} \left(3^{-n} \mathbf{A}^{n}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 833, 920, 852]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 527, 92]]<|/det|>
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 201, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>EITHER</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 151, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
The roots of the equation \(x^{4} - 3x^{2} + 5x - 2 = 0\) are \(\alpha , \beta , \gamma , \delta\) , and \(\alpha^{n} + \beta^{n} + \gamma^{n} + \delta^{n}\) is denoted by \(S_{n}\) . Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 186, 625, 207]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n + 4} - 3S_{n + 2} + 5S_{n + 1} - 2S_{n} = 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 186, 920, 205]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 222, 267, 240]]<|/det|>
Find the values of

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 247, 156, 266]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 247, 243, 266]]<|/det|>
\(S_{2}\) and \(S_{4}\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 248, 920, 266]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 272, 151, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 272, 243, 291]]<|/det|>
\(S_{3}\) and \(S_{5}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 272, 920, 291]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 303, 308, 320]]<|/det|>
Hence find the value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[203, 325, 792, 348]]<|/det|>
\[\alpha^{2}\big(\beta^{3} + \gamma^{3} + \delta^{3}\big) + \beta^{2}\big(\gamma^{3} + \delta^{3} + \alpha^{3}\big) + \gamma^{2}\big(\delta^{3} + \alpha^{3} + \beta^{3}\big) + \delta^{2}\big(\alpha^{3} + \beta^{3} + \gamma^{3}\big).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 327, 920, 346]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 386, 153, 403]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 732, 435]]<|/det|>
The linear transformation \(\mathbf{T}: \mathbb{R}^{4} \to \mathbb{R}^{3}\) is represented by the matrix \(\mathbf{M}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 440, 611, 496]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{M} = \left( \begin{array}{cccc}2 & 1 & -1 & 4\\ 3 & 4 & 6 & 1\\ -1 & 2 & 8 & -7 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 500, 440, 518]]<|/det|>
The range space of \(\mathrm{T}\) is \(R\). In any order,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 526, 151, 544]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 526, 432, 544]]<|/det|>
show that the dimension of \(R\) is 2,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 551, 151, 568]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 551, 598, 568]]<|/det|>
find a basis for \(R\) and obtain a cartesian equation for \(R\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 575, 151, 593]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 575, 435, 593]]<|/det|>
find a basis for the null space of T.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 591, 920, 609]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 618, 256, 667]]<|/det|>
The vector \(\begin{array}{r}{\left(\begin{array}{c}{8}\\ {7}\\ {k}\end{array}\right)} \end{array}\) belongs to \(R\). Find the value of \(k\) and, with this value of \(k\), find the general solution of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 682, 551, 725]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{M}\mathbf{x} = \begin{pmatrix} 8 \\ 7 \\ k \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 694, 920, 712]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
